title: I LOVE LISTS
description: I LOVE LISTS 10 of the tallest abandoned skyscrapers. Let’s look at all the discontinued foods of the past. Instagram might launch a Reels-only app. Curious! A wearable camera that helps blind people see. How fast food apps are changing the game. Does dish soap ever go bad? I guess this is the Rosie we wanted in the Jetsons. Reframing your relationship with technology. Here’s what the youth looked like in the 70s. More of us want to travel solo. For Joan Didion fans who live in NY. (lucky) Here are some ways to use your culinary torch. Don’t be a jerk while taking photos in restaurants. RIP Gene Hackman Here are some Gene Hackman quotes. Are we ready to fall in love with steaming food? The best astrology books to start with. This is the one I started with. Weekend plans: adding chocolate syrup to things Checked out from the library: What I Ate in One Year View this post on Instagram A post shared by the handwriting club (@thehandwritingclub) Wanna hang out and journal? I’m hosting a Show & Tell for my paid substack subscribers on Zoom tonight! We will be going over our February pages in our Currently Workbooks. 5PM-6PM PST You can watch me work on my February pages on my YouTube channel: The post I LOVE LISTS appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: I Love Lists is a weekly roundup of the best links from around the internet, curated by Tracy Benjamin of Shutterbean. Discover inspiring reads, creative ideas, delicious recipes, and fun finds every week!
text: I LOVE LISTS  10 of the tallest abandoned skyscrapers.  Let’s look at all the discontinued foods of the past.  Instagram might launch a Reels-only app. Curious!  A wearable camera that helps blind people see.  How fast food apps are changing the game.  Does dish soap ever go bad?  I guess this is the Rosie we wanted in the Jetsons.  Reframing your relationship with technology.  Here’s what the youth looked like in the 70s.  More of us want to travel solo. For Joan Didion fans who live in NY. (lucky) Here are some ways to use your culinary torch. Don’t be a jerk while taking photos in restaurants.  RIP Gene Hackman Here are some Gene Hackman quotes.  Are we ready to fall in love with steaming food? The best astrology books to start with.  This is the one I started with.  Weekend plans: adding chocolate syrup to things Checked out from the library: What I Ate in One Year Wanna hang out and journal? I’m hosting a Show & Tell for my paid substack subscribers on Zoom tonight! We will be going over our February pages in our Currently Workbooks.  5PM-6PM PST You can watch me work on my February pages on my YouTube channel:    Back to top
html:
I LOVE LISTS 

  1. 10 of the tallest abandoned skyscrapers. 
  2. Let’s look at all the discontinued foods of the past. 
  3. Instagram might launch a Reels-only app. Curious! 
  4. A wearable camera that helps blind people see. 
  5. How fast food apps are changing the game. 
  6. Does dish soap ever go bad? 
  7. I guess this is the Rosie we wanted in the Jetsons. 
  8. Reframing your relationship with technology. 
  9. Here’s what the youth looked like in the 70s. 
  10. More of us want to travel solo.
  11. For Joan Didion fans who live in NY. (lucky)
  12. Here are some ways to use your culinary torch.
  13. Don’t be a jerk while taking photos in restaurants. 
  14. RIP Gene Hackman
  15. Here are some Gene Hackman quotes. 
  16. Are we ready to fall in love with steaming food?
  17. The best astrology books to start with. 
  18. This is the one I started with. 
  19. Weekend plans: adding chocolate syrup to things
  20. Checked out from the library: What I Ate in One Year

Wanna hang out and journal? I’m hosting a Show & Tell for my paid substack subscribers on Zoom tonight! We will be going over our February pages in our Currently Workbooks.  5PM-6PM PST

You can watch me work on my February pages on my YouTube channel:
